title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: members, contributors, leaders pledge make participation community harassment-free experience everyone, regardless age, body size, visible invisible disability, ethnicity, sex characteristics, gender identity expression, level experience, education, socio-economic status, nationality, personal appearance, race, caste, color, religion, sexual identity orientation. pledge act interact ways contribute open, welcoming, diverse, inclusive, healthy community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Examples behavior contributes positive environment community include: Demonstrating empathy kindness toward people respectful differing opinions, viewpoints, experiences Giving gracefully accepting constructive feedback Accepting responsibility apologizing affected mistakes, learning experience Focusing best just us individuals, overall community Examples unacceptable behavior include: use sexualized language imagery, sexual attention advances kind Trolling, insulting derogatory comments, personal political attacks Public private harassment Publishing others’ private information, physical email address, without explicit permission conduct reasonably considered inappropriate professional setting

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders responsible clarifying enforcing standards acceptable behavior take appropriate fair corrective action response behavior deem inappropriate, threatening, offensive, harmful. Community leaders right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct, communicate reasons moderation decisions appropriate.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct applies within community spaces, also applies individual officially representing community public spaces. Examples representing community include using official e-mail address, posting via official social media account, acting appointed representative online offline event.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported community leaders responsible enforcement luis@liomys.mx. complaints reviewed investigated promptly fairly. community leaders obligated respect privacy security reporter incident.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community leaders follow Community Impact Guidelines determining consequences action deem violation Code Conduct:

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Use inappropriate language behavior deemed unprofessional unwelcome community. Consequence: private, written warning community leaders, providing clarity around nature violation explanation behavior inappropriate. public apology may requested.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: violation single incident series actions. Consequence: warning consequences continued behavior. interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, specified period time. includes avoiding interactions community spaces well external channels like social media. Violating terms may lead temporary permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: serious violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior. Consequence: temporary ban sort interaction public communication community specified period time. public private interaction people involved, including unsolicited interaction enforcing Code Conduct, allowed period. Violating terms may lead permanent ban.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Community Impact: Demonstrating pattern violation community standards, including sustained inappropriate behavior, harassment individual, aggression toward disparagement classes individuals. Consequence: permanent ban sort public interaction within community.

title: Contributor Covenant Code of Conduct
text: Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant, version 2.1, available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/version/2/1/code_of_conduct.html. Community Impact Guidelines inspired [Mozilla’s code conduct enforcement ladder][https://github.com/mozilla/inclusion]. answers common questions code conduct, see FAQ https://www.contributor-covenant.org/faq. Translations available https://www.contributor-covenant.org/translations.

title: Introduction to annotater
text: package works around suite functions match package load calls (.e. library require) character string one line per element, replace annotated versions. version 0.2.0, loading packages pacman::p_load also supported. First, match_pkg_names produces tibble package load calls package names. values tabular output passed utils::packageDescription, parses returns ‘DESCRIPTION’ file installed package. Fields interest descriptions used build annotations. ‘Title’ field package’s description makes good summary , annotate_pkg_calls uses build annotations. titles inserted package load call, separated commenting symbol. similar approach used annotate_repo_source paste repository source version number. Titles, repositories version numbers can annotated together output annotate_repostitle. annotate functions called loaded package, use annotate_fun_calls. annotate datasets called loaded package, use annotate_pkg_datasets.
code:
pkgs_string <- c("library(boot)
require(Matrix)") match_pkg_names(pkgs_string) #> # A tibble: 2 × 3 #>   call            package_name pkgname_clean #>   <chr>           <chr>        <chr>         #> 1 library(boot)   boot         boot          #> 2 require(Matrix) Matrix       Matrix pkgs_string <- c("library(boot)
require(tools)") annotate_pkg_calls(pkgs_string) #> [1] "library(boot) # Bootstrap Functions (Originally by Angelo Canty for S)
require(tools) # Tools for Package Development" pkgs_string <- c("library(boot)
require(lattice)") annotate_repo_source(pkgs_string) #> [1] "library(boot)    # [standard::NA/NA] v1.3-31
require(lattice) # [standard::NA/NA] v0.22-6" pkgs_string <- c("library(boot)
require(lattice)") annotate_repostitle(pkgs_string) #> [1] "library(boot) # Bootstrap Functions (Originally by Angelo Canty for S) [standard::NA/NA] v1.3-31 # Bootstrap Functions (Originally by Angelo Canty for S) CRAN v1.3-31
require(lattice) # Trellis Graphics for R [standard::NA/NA] v0.22-6 # Trellis Graphics for R CRAN v0.22-6" testcode <- c('library(purrr)  x <- list("a", 1, c("bo","bi","bu")) pluck(x, 1) map(x, pluck, 2)') annotate_fun_calls(testcode) #> [1] "library(purrr) # pluck map 
x <- list("a", 1, c("bo","bi","bu"))
pluck(x, 1)
map(x, pluck, 2)" testcode <- c('library(tidyr)  summary(household) plot(fish_encounters)') annotate_pkg_datasets(testcode) #> [1] "library(tidyr) # fish_encounters household 
summary(household)
plot(fish_encounters)"

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: goal annotater add informative comments package load calls character strings, R, RMarkdown, Quarto files, can idea overall purpose libraries loading.

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: Install CRAN release development version : Restart RStudio installation addins load properly.
code: # Install from CRAN: install.packages("annotater") # development version ## install.packages("remotes") remotes::install_github("luisDVA/annotater")

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: Either functions working interactively RStudio addins, package load calls can enhanced different types relevant information, added comments next call. example code shows output different functions.

what: What do my loaded packages do?
title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: Package tiles respective DESCRIPTION files can added load calls.
code: library(brms) # Bayesian Regression Models using 'Stan' library(picante) # Integrating Phylogenies and Ecology library(report) # Automated Reporting of Results and Statistical Models library(tidybayes) # Tidy Data and 'Geoms' for Bayesian Models

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: Package installation sources installed version numbers added load calls. Supports installations CRAN, Bioconductor, GitHub, GitLab, R-universe. two annotation types also available together:
code: library(brms)      # CRAN v2.21.0 library(forcats)   # CRAN v1.0.0 library(report)    # [github::easystats/report] v0.6.1 library(tidybayes) # CRAN v3.0.6 library(picante) # Integrating Phylogenies and Ecology CRAN v1.8.2 library(forcats) # Tools for Working with Categorical Variables (Factors) CRAN v1.0.0 library(report) # Automated Reporting of Results and Statistical Models [github::easystats/report] v0.6.1 library(tidybayes) # Tidy Data and 'Geoms' for Bayesian Models CRAN v3.0.6

what: Which functions or datasets from a package are being used?
title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: given package, annotater can make notes functions datasets used current file. functions use: Loaded datasets:
code: library(ggplot2) # ggplot aes geom_bar library(dplyr) # group_by summarize mutate library(palmerpenguins) # No used functions found library(forcats) # fct_reorder library(data.table) # No used functions found  data(penguins)  summary_stats <- penguins |>   group_by(species, sex) |>   summarize(     mnmass = mean(body_mass_g),     medmass = median(body_mass_g)   ) |>   mutate(species = fct_reorder(species, mnmass))  ggplot(summary_stats, aes(x = species, y = medmass, fill = sex)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge") library(ggplot2) # No loaded datasets found library(dplyr) # No loaded datasets found library(palmerpenguins) # penguins library(forcats) # No loaded datasets found library(data.table) # No loaded datasets found  data(penguins)  summary_stats <- penguins |>   group_by(species, sex) |>   summarize(     mnmass = mean(body_mass_g),     medmass = median(body_mass_g)   ) |>   mutate(species = fct_reorder(species, mnmass))  ggplot(summary_stats, aes(x = species, y = medmass, fill = sex)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity", position = "dodge")

title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: Users pacman package can now use annotater functions p_load() calls. includes calls multiple package names (e.g. p_load(ggplot2,purrr)), split across lines readability.

what: R version and session information an as annotation
title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: addin ‘Annotate R version’ add current machine’s R version, platform, operating system RStudio version beginnning file. can useful reproducibility debugging.
code: # R version 4.4.3 (2025-02-28) # Platform: x86_64-pc-linux-gnu # Running under: Linux Mint 22.1 # Rstudio 2024.12.0.467 (Kousa Dogwood) #  library(brms) library(dplyr) library(tidybayes)

what: A note on the tidyverse and other metapacakges
title: Annotate Package Load Calls
text: tidyverse package metapackage exported functions , annotation tools provided (e.g. annotate_fun_calls) match functions various individual packages (dplyr readr) attached loading tidyverse. Consider using expand_metapackages function first annotations function calls datasets desired. Load calls metapackages split separate library() calls individual packages form core tidyverse, tidymodels, easystats. Becomes:
code: library(tidyverse) library(tidymodels) #### library(ggplot2) library(tibble) library(tidyr) library(readr) library(purrr) library(dplyr) library(stringr) library(forcats) library(lubridate) #### #### library(broom) library(dials) library(dplyr) library(ggplot2) library(infer) library(modeldata) library(parsnip) library(purrr) library(recipes) library(rsample) library(tibble) library(tidyr) library(tune) library(workflows) library(workflowsets) library(yardstick) ####

code:
test_string <- c("library(tidyr)
library(purrr)
data(construction)
summary(fish_encounters)") annotate_pkg_datasets(test_string) #> [1] "library(tidyr) # construction fish_encounters
library(purrr) # No loaded datasets found
data(construction)
summary(fish_encounters)"

title: annotater 0.2.3

title: annotater 0.2.1
